ai.summary: A 13.6 km moderate hike on the Forest of Dean Sculpture Trail in the UK, weaving through ancient woodlands and along gentle trails to reveal a collection of outdoor sculptures.
ai.terrain_summary: The route follows well-marked forest tracks and occasional forest roads. Expect a mix of compact earth, gravel, short gentle ascents, and some uneven roots. Wet weather can make sections muddy; most of the path is shaded by trees.
ai.safety_notes: Plan for variable UK weather; check forecast and wear appropriate clothing. Wear sturdy waterproof hiking boots and bring a waterproof jacket and extra layers. Stay on marked paths and follow trail signs; some sections can be slippery when wet. Carry a map or offline navigation and know how to read it; mobile signal may be limited in deeper woodland. Inform someone of your plans and expected return time. Watch for other hikers and cyclists on shared trails. Protect against ticks and insects with repellent; check for ticks after the hike. Carry enough water and snacks for 13.6 km; know your limits and take breaks as needed. In winter daylight is limited; start early or adjust plan.
recommended_gear: Map and compass or offline navigation
Fully charged phone and power bank
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn; year-round visits possible with variable conditions.

seo.meta_description: Explore the 13.6 km Forest of Dean Sculpture Trail in the UK. A moderate, scenic hike through woodlands with outdoor sculptures along well-marked paths. Practical safety and gear tips.
